content: On performance of the departments under him, he says ‚ÄòAmarajeevi Jaladhara‚Äô, completion of 4,300-km of roads in villages, and implementation of ‚ÄòAdavi Talli Baata‚Äô are major highlights

title: ‚ÄòWall of Happiness‚Äô provides clothes to the needy with steady trickle of contribution
content: Laundered used clothes are placed on the 18 shelves provided for the purpose in the facility, which is monitored by surveillance cameras; the initiative was launched by the Corporation in 2017

title: 2025: Year in Review
content: Celebration and revelry, conflict and chaos, resilience and revolt, rifts and alliances ‚Äî the year 2025 had it all. From ballot boxes to battlefields, from stadiums to screens, here‚Äôs a look back at the year that was

title: CBI books South Delhi resident for 'misusing' names of PM Modi, his Principal Secretary
content: Claiming privileged access to the Prime Minister's Office (PMO), Nisheeth Kohli, a resident of Vasant Kunj, said he wished to help the government of India develop an indigenous military jet engine

title: Package of banned items hurled into Mysuru jail premises, case registered with city police
content: The package contained a mobile charger with connector, mobile battery, nine packets of beedis and one packet of cigarettes, besides stones.

title: Hold correspondence for NAAC accreditation in Kannada: Department of Collegiate Education orders colleges
content: A Kannada professor had filed a complaint with the Kannada Development Authority alleging that the Kannada department is being forced to prepare all documents in English on the pretext of UGC and NAAC accreditation

title: BDA calls tenders for tunnel-flyover between Hebbal and Mehkri Circle, project to cost ‚Çπ1,655 crore now
content: The project involves building a 2.25 km short tunnel from Hebbal junction (below the flyover and the railway line) to Karnataka Veterinary, Animal and Fisheries Sciences University (KVAFSU), and a 1.7 km long flyover till Mehkri Circle.

title: Government may take cognisance of land-related cases against Lalu, says Bihar dy CM
content: If someone brings an application to Jan Kalyan Samvad in this regard, our officials‚Ä¶ our government will certainly take cognisance, says Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Vijay Kumar Sinha

title: European Union carbon tax unacceptable, hurting exporting costs: Jairam Ramesh

title: Health dept. begins detailed inquiry into death of two undergoing dialysis at Haripad taluk hospital in Kerala
content: Dialysis unit in the hospital will remain closed for 15 days. A full technical evaluation conducted by the Health department team at the hospital dialysis unit on Thursday could not find anything adverse

title: Hindu refugees from Bangladesh will be most affected by SIR in West Bengal: CPI(M) leader
content: I am in favour of the SIR. But this is a huge and quite challenging task. To make it more foolproof and precise, more time should have been allocated, says Senior CPI(M) leader Kanti Ganguly

content: Chelsea have confirmed they have parted ways with manager Enzo Maresca ahead of Sunday's game against Manchester City.

content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning wrapped up Citrus Bowl MVP honors with a 60-yard scoring run in a 41-27 victory over No. 14 Michigan.

content: Anthony Edwards made an unplanned and unapproved exit Wednesday, leaving the court and the bench during a timeout late in Minnesota's loss at Atlanta.

title: Packers claim CB Diggs to help ailing secondary
content: The Packers on Wednesday claimed veteran cornerback Trevon Diggs, a day after he was waived by the Cowboys.

title: Steelers' Rodgers to ponder 'options,' retirement
content: Steelers QB Aaron Rodgers, 42, said he hasn't "thought about" a return to Pittsburgh next season, as he has been focused on the Week 18 showdown against the Baltimore Ravens. But he acknowledges that he'll need to make a decision when the season ends.

content: Identifying players to spend up for, teams to stack, value picks to grab and players you need to avoid.

title: 36-Year-Old Autorickshaw Driver Stabbed To Death In Bengaluru: Cops
content: An unidentified man allegedly stabbed a 36-year-old autorickshaw driver to death in the early hours of Thursday here, police said.

title: Probe Agency Suspects More Gold Lost From Sabarimala Than Recovered So Far
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the Sabarimala gold loss case suspects that more gold was lost from the temple than what has been recovered so far from the prime accused.

title: "If System Was Unfair...": Deepinder Goyal On Gig Workers' Strike
content: Delivery platforms Zomato and Blinkit have achieved record delivery numbers on New Year's Eve, despite calls for strikes over the past few days, said their founder and Chief Executive Officer Deepinder Goyal today.

title: '200 People Tried To Escape In 30 Seconds': Witness Recalls Swiss Fire Horror
content: Soon after midnight, a fire ripped through a bar's New Year celebration in a Swiss Alpine resort. Dozens of people are feared dead, and about 100 more are injured, most seriously, police said.

title: "Attempt To Defame": Temple After Couple Claims They Found Snail In Prasad
content: The Gopalpatnam police in Andhra Pradesh have launched an investigation into the viral "snail in prasadam" controversy at the Sri Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Simhachalam.

title: Tied To Pole, Dragged By Hair: Newlywed Man Assaulted By In-Laws In Andhra Pradesh
content: A brutal case of vigilante violence came to light in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru district after a young man was publicly humiliated and assaulted for marrying his long-time partner against her family's wishes.

title: On Sabarimala Gold Theft, P Vijayan Raises Questions On Sonia Gandhi Again
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, on Thursday, ruled out the need for a Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) probe at this stage into the Sabarimala gold heist case.

title: New Year Rush: Delhi Zoo Welcomes Over 25,000 Visitors
content: The Delhi zoo witnessed a significant spike in visitor footfall on New Year's Day, with the numbers rising by nearly 86 per cent on Thursday as compared to regular weekdays during this time of the year, officials said.

title: Hindu Man Attacked, Set On Fire In Bangladesh, Escapes By Jumping Into Pond
content: Khokon Das, another Hindu man, was attacked by a violent group in Bangladesh. The 50-year-old was injured after the attack and set on fire. The incident took place on December 31 in the Shariatpur district of the country.

title: Mother Waited Years, Got 10 Months With Grandson: Man On Indore Water Tragedy
content: She became a grandmother but didn't even get 10 months with her grandson. Urmila Yadav was healthy by every measure that mattered.

title: "She Left At 8.30 PM, Was Waiting For Auto": Sister Of Woman Raped In Faridabad
content: The sister of the woman who got gangraped two days ago in Faridabad, said they last spoke in the evening of that terrible day. Her sister, she said, was very upset at the time.

title: 40 Killed In Fire During New Year Party At Swiss Ski Resort Bar: Report
content: Crans Montana Blast: Several people were killed and many others injured in a massive explosion at a luxury ski resort town in Switzerland's Crans Montana.

title: 21-Year-Old Killed In Iran Protests Over Economy As Inflation Hits 42%
content: One man was killed in Iran on Wednesday night, state television said, the first death reported after days of demonstrations over high inflation that mark the most significant unrest since nationwide protests three years ago.

title: Telangana Rakes In Rs 5,102 Crore From Liquor Sales In December 2025
content: Telangana's liquor sales reached a historic high in December 2025, with the state exchequer raking in a record-breaking Rs 5,102 crore.

title: Saudi Arabia Carried Out Record 356 Executions In 2025
content: Saudi authorities executed 356 people in 2025, according to an AFP tally, setting a new record for the number of inmates put to death in the kingdom in a single year.

title: Video: Spire Of 150-Year-Old Amsterdam Church Collapses During Fire
content: A huge inferno destroyed a 19th-century Amsterdam church Thursday, as the Netherlands endured an unsettled New Year's Eve with two dead from fireworks and "unprecedented" violence against police.

title: Cricketer Plays Match In J&K With Palestine Flag on Helmet, Summoned By Cops
content: A controversy has erupted over the use of the Palestinian flag by a cricketer during a domestic league match in Jammu and Kashmir. Furqan Bhat had used a Palestinian flag on his helmet while playing a match in the Jammu and Kashmir Champions League.

title: 167 Indians In Pak Await Return Despite Completing Sentences: Centre
content: Under provisions of the bilateral Agreement on Consular Access 2008, India and Pakistan on Thursday exchanged, through diplomatic channels, simultaneously in New Delhi and Islamabad, the lists of civil prisoners and fishermen in each other's custody.

title: 'Need Awareness, Education': Himanta Sarma On Tripura Student's Murder In Dehradun
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has called the killing of Tripura student Anjel Chakma for objecting to people using racial slurs in Uttarakhand a "sad and unfortunate" incident.

title: Jadavpur University Student Says She Was Asked To Remove Hijab, Panel Probes
content: The West Bengal Minorities Commission has initiated an inquiry into allegations that a hijab-wearing student of Jadavpur University was asked to remove her headscarf during an English examination on December 22 on suspicion of cheating.

title: 'Ceiling on fire': Panicked partygoers smashed windows; witnesses recount Swiss bar horror
content: A devastating fire ripped through a packed New Year's Eve party at a Swiss ski resort bar, causing panic and a desperate escape. Witnesses described scenes of chaos as revellers smashed windows to flee flames and smoke. Dozens are feared dead and over 100 injured, with many young people believed to be among the victims.

title: Hindu man attacked in Bangladesh: Mob pours petrol, sets him on fire; victim critical
content: The incident took place around 9.30 pm in the Damudya area, near Keurbhanga Bazar in the Koneshwar Union. The victim, 50-year-old Khokon Chandra Das, was reportedly waylaid, beaten and doused with petrol before being set ablaze, reported news agency ANI, citing Prothom Alo. Das was later shifted to Dhaka for advanced treatment as his condition worsened, the report said.

title: Ukraine attack on Putin residence: After CIA rejects claim, Russia to give proof to US
content: Russia stated it recovered data from a downed Ukrainian drone. Moscow claims this data shows the drone targeted a Russian presidential residence. Russia will share this information with the United States. Ukraine and US officials have denied the alleged attack. This incident follows a meeting between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title: 'Anaconda strategy': Will Xi Jinping risk it all over Taiwan in 2026?
content: China's military drills near Taiwan, timed with the approaching 2027 deadline, signal Beijing's growing assertiveness under President Xi Jinping. The US is bolstering Taiwan's defenses amid concerns about delayed weapons and industrial capacity. Analysts warn of China's 'Anaconda strategy' and the potential for miscalculation, as Xi Jinping faces pressure to achieve 'reunification'.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Over 70 wishes to share ‚Äî images, quotes, status & more
content: As 2026 approaches, the article highlights the diverse ways people celebrate and express New Year's wishes. It emphasizes the value of simple, heartfelt messages, relatable quotes, and genuine status updates, alongside visual elements like images and wallpapers, to connect with loved ones during this transitional period.

title: Kioxia's 540% Stock Surge: Tokyo firm tops global charts; AI memory demand drives record gains
content: While Nvidia and other US tech giants saw significant gains in 2025, Kioxia Holdings of Tokyo emerged as the world's best-performing stock. The memory chip maker's shares surged 540%, driven by the AI boom's insatiable demand for NAND flash memory to store massive datasets, outperforming all others in the MSCI World Index.

title: Inside India‚Äôs Rs 5 canteens: From Tamil Nadu to Delhi, how cooked meals fill the last-mile gap
content: Delhi's new Atal Canteens offer a Rs 5 meal, joining a national trend of government-run low-cost food initiatives. These canteens aim to provide dignified, affordable nutrition to daily wage earners and the urban poor. While demand is high, initial operations faced challenges with supply and capacity, highlighting the ongoing need for such services across India.

title: Kargil hero in Bengal voter drive: Ex-soldier queues up to reclaim rights amid SIR gap
content: A Kargil war hero, Sanjib Bhattacharya, and his family are among 32 lakh citizens in Bengal facing hearings to regain voting rights after being excluded from the 2002 electoral rolls due to border duty and job assignments outside the state. Residents and a local councillor expressed anger over the perceived harassment of former soldiers, calling for special arrangements.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
content: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

title: Plan first, invest later: Why choice between new & old tax regimes requires deep planning
content: Taxpayers are facing higher tax outgo due to incorrect regime choices, often stemming from misunderstandings of exemptions and documentation. Experts advise projecting liabilities under both regimes, with high HRA and rent payments favoring the old system, while low rent benefits the new.

title: 'Turn up the heat': Trump shares editorial critical of Putin amid failing Ukraine talks
content: US President Donald Trump is intensifying pressure on Russia's Vladimir Putin, advocating for a tougher stance amid stalled Ukraine peace talks. An editorial shared by Trump argues Russia is obstructing peace, urging Washington to abandon concessions and adopt a "bigger stick" approach. This comes as both sides report escalating hostilities and drone attacks, underscoring the volatile situation.

title: Battle of the Sexes: 'I love revenge'- Sabalenka calls for rematch with Kyrgios
content: World number one Aryna Sabalenka is eager for a rematch against Nick Kyrgios after their exhibition "Battle of the Sexes" loss. She believes a full-sized court and adjusted serving rules would better level the playing field for a second encounter. Sabalenka expressed confidence in her ability to learn from the defeat and secure revenge.

title: Tesla's former AI boss: Google Waymo cannot match Tesla self driving tech; explains the reason
content: Former Tesla AI chief Andrej Karpathy believes Google's Waymo couldn't replicate Tesla's recent coast-to-coast autonomous drive. He highlighted Tesla's end-to-end neural network versus Waymo's modular system, which struggled during a San Francisco power outage. Karpathy praised the milestone despite recent criticism from Elon Musk about his "dated" views.

title: Bullet train by 2027! Key routes revealed; which cities will be linked first?
content: India's first bullet train is slated for a 2027 launch, with the Surat to Bilimora section opening first.  The ambitious Mumbai-Ahmedabad corridor, developed with Japan, promises speeds up to 320 kmph, drastically cutting travel time.  Additionally, the first Vande Bharat sleeper train will debut in January 2026, offering comfortable overnight journeys.

title: Ashes: 'If they get pummelled‚Ä¶'- Ex-England captain issues warning for Stokes & McCullum
content: Michael Vaughan dismisses England's Melbourne Test win as a 'lottery', urging the team to prove their mettle in Sydney. He stresses that a competitive performance in the final Ashes Test is crucial for the Brendon McCullum-Ben Stokes regime to avoid scrutiny, emphasizing the need for honest reflection on mistakes rather than denial.

title: 'Not terror attack': At least 40 dead in Swiss bar fire; over 100 hurt, many with severe burns
content: An explosion tore through Le Constellation bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana during New Year's celebrations, killing several people and injuring others. Nearly 100 people were inside the popular tourist spot when the blast occurred shortly after midnight. Authorities have cordoned off the area and imposed a no-fly zone as emergency operations and investigations into the cause continue.

title: ODI cricket: 'Slow death' ‚Äì Ashwin's chilling warning after Kohli-Rohit era
content: Ravichandran Ashwin expressed serious doubts about the long-term future of ODI cricket, suggesting it might not survive beyond the 2027 World Cup after the departure of stars like Kohli and Sharma. He highlighted the growing dominance of T20 leagues and Test cricket's enduring appeal, noting that ODI relevance heavily relies on its biggest names.

title: India‚ÄìChina reset: From Galwan storm to tactical calm; how long can this balance hold?
content: India and China have resumed high-level engagements and reopened trade channels after years of frosty relations, a move driven by mutual necessity rather than trust. While diplomatic and commercial ties see a surface thaw, deep-seated rivalries and unresolved border disputes persist, raising questions about the sustainability of this fragile detente.

title: Faridabad gangrape case: Woman‚Äôs cries unheard on foggy, isolated road ‚Äî chilling details emerge
content: A 25-year-old woman endured a harrowing ordeal, allegedly gang-raped for nearly three hours inside a moving van on a fog-shrouded Gurgaon-Faridabad Road. Her cries for help went unheard due to the dense fog and isolation. Police have arrested two van drivers, with further identification procedures pending. The victim sustained severe injuries and is recovering.

title: Maha civic polls: Shiva Sena aspirant swallows 'A & B form' of fellow party candidate
content: A Shiv Sena candidate in Pune has been booked after allegedly swallowing nomination forms belonging to a rival party member at a ward office. The incident occurred when the candidate attempted to tear the form, then fled to the washroom and consumed it. Police have registered a case against him.

title: Delhi sees record 8.16 L vehicle sales in '25: Private petrol vehicles dominate
content: Delhi witnessed record vehicle sales in 2025, overwhelmingly dominated by private petrol vehicles, raising concerns about worsening congestion and pollution. Experts highlight the need for stronger EV promotion and improved public transport to counter this trend. The surge, driven by economic factors and post-Covid shifts, underscores the city's environmental challenges.

title: 5 job-market trends to watch in 2026: AI literacy, cautious hiring and the new filters
content: In 2026, skills will stop working like a checklist and start functioning as hiring signals. As AI becomes universal, employers will screen for judgment, learning speed and proof of work rather than credentials alone. Drawing on global hiring data, this piece outlines five job-market trends college students and young professionals should watch as cautious employers raise new filters.

title: What 2026 has in mind for Donald Trump
content: While conquering the world geographically is a tad hard these days, there is no semblance of doubt that 2025 was Donald Trump‚Äôs year, a man who rode back into the White House and instantly went about dismantling everything: American soft power, the ‚Äúdeep state‚Äù, the global economy, the rules-based international order, the White House‚Äôs East Wing, and anything else he could get his hands on.

title: Amsterdam: Fire engulfs iconic Vondelkerk church during New Year celebrations; watch
content: A fire ravaged the spire of Amsterdam's Vondelkerk church on New Year's Day, causing partial destruction. The incident occurred amidst a night of widespread fireworks-related violence and attacks on emergency services across the Netherlands, leading to injuries and a nationwide mobile alert.

title: 'Why can‚Äôt we?': Ex-India cricketer questions ODI scheduling with Virat, Rohit in focus
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's selective ODI appearances have revitalized the format, drawing significant fan interest. Their continued commitment and strong performances, reflected in the batting rankings, have restored anticipation. Former cricketer Irfan Pathan advocates for longer series and multi-team tournaments to sustain this momentum and capitalize on their impact.

title: Wayanad tragedy worsens: Man found dead in Israel, wife dies after consuming poison
content: Reshma, wife of Jinesh Sukumaran who died in Israel, has died after an alleged suicide attempt. Jinesh was found dead in Israel in July. Reshma reportedly consumed poison at her home. The couple has a 10-year-old daughter. Jinesh had moved to Israel in June. The funeral will be held on Thursday.

title: India, Pak exchange list of nuke sites: What is 1988 agreement? Explained
content: India and Pakistan have exchanged lists of their nuclear installations and facilities, marking the 35th consecutive annual update under a 1988 agreement. This routine exchange, continuing even during periods of tension, aims to prevent accidental or deliberate attacks on critical nuclear infrastructure, fostering predictability between the two nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: Virat Kohli adds special emoji, posts picture with Anushka Sharma - See pic
content: Virat Kohli celebrated New Year's Day 2026 with wife Anushka Sharma, sharing intimate moments on social media.  Kohli recently made a return to India‚Äôs premier domestic one-day competition for the first time in 15 years and made an immediate impact. Kohli struck scores of 131 and 77 in successive innings, reaffirming his class and enduring hunger for runs.

title: Drone attack on Crimea hotel? At least 24 killed; Russia blames Ukraine
content: Russia claims a Ukrainian drone strike killed at least 24 people and injured over 50 at a hotel and caf√© in occupied Kherson during New Year celebrations. This follows Russia's accusation of a "terrorist act" targeting President Putin's residence, which Ukraine denies.

title: Ashes: Australia announce squad for fifth Test - Khawaja retained, no Cummins
content: Australia has revealed their 15-member squad for the final Ashes Test in Sydney, with Steve Smith captaining again. Pat Cummins is rested to manage his workload ahead of the 2026 T20 World Cup. Usman Khawaja retains his spot despite a mixed series. The team aims to bounce back after their recent defeat.

title: Pan India kidney racket exposed: Police names doc in organ trade; int'l links probed
content: Chandrapur police have busted a pan-India kidney trafficking ring with international ties, implicating two specialist doctors from Delhi and Trichy. The racket, involving illegal transplants in India and abroad, was exposed by a debt-ridden farmer. Investigations reveal a well-organized network of agents, donors, and hospitals, with transplants priced between ‚Çπ50 lakh and ‚Çπ80 lakh.

title: Indore water contamination deaths: Born after 10 years, family loses 6-month-old son
content: A six-month-old boy, born after a decade-long wait, has tragically died in Indore, allegedly due to contaminated drinking water. The infant developed severe symptoms, leading to his death. Chief Minister Mohan Yadav visited affected hospitals, ordered compensation for the deceased's family, and announced free treatment for all. Officials have been suspended and dismissed following the incident.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper to be launched in January! Check fares, route & other details
content: The first Vande Bharat sleeper train will run between Guwahati and Kolkata, Ashwini Vaishnaw announced on Thursday. Each Vande Bharat sleeper train has 16 coaches. The composition of the coaches is: 11 AC 3-tier, 4 AC 2-tier, and one AC 1st coach. The train can accommodate 823 passengers.

title: Feb 1 GST hit: Cigarette, bidi, pan masala to attract 40% tax ‚Äî check details
content: Starting February 1, tobacco and pan masala products will face new taxes. The government is introducing additional excise duties and a health cess, replacing the existing GST compensation cess. Pan masala will be taxed at 40% GST plus a new cess, while biris will attract 18% GST.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection vs 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'
content: Aditya Dhar's espionage thriller 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal run, crossing THIS amount on its 28th day.  Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's rom-com 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' has faltered, earning less than Rs 30 crore by its eighth day, failing to gain traction despite the Christmas holiday.

title: BSNL offers WiFi calling nationwide ‚Äî No additional cost, no third-party apps & more
content: BSNL has launched its Voice over Wi-Fi (VoWiFi) service nationwide from January 1, 2026, enabling subscribers to make and receive calls and messages over any Wi-Fi network at no extra cost. This initiative aims to enhance call quality and reliability, particularly in indoor and remote areas with limited mobile coverage, while also reducing network congestion.

title: UP: Drunk masked man in Bijnor holds minor at knifepoint, demands Rs 1L & bike; arrested
content: A 24-year-old man held a minor girl hostage at knifepoint in a Najibabad clothing shop. He demanded Rs 1 lakh and a motorcycle. Police arrived swiftly and rescued the girl. The man, who appeared intoxicated, was apprehended. He stated he wanted to go to jail. Further investigation is underway.

title: Indore water contamination deaths: Probe exposes major lapses; residents told to avoid tap water
content: Seven deaths have been reported in Indore's Bhagirathpura following a water contamination incident, with 162 patients hospitalized. A probe revealed a newly constructed toilet dumping waste directly above a loose joint in the main water supply pipeline, causing the contamination. Authorities are flushing the system and providing alternative water sources.

title: Esha Deol pays tribute to late father Dharmendra as she rings in New Year 2026
content: Esha Deol celebrated New Year's Eve in Dubai, dedicating a heartfelt tribute to her late father, Dharmendra, by posing with the moon and a touching note.  Her brother, Bobby Deol, shared his love in the comments.  This comes as Dharmendra's final film, 'Ikkis,' a war biopic, releases today, marking his last performance and leaving a precious memory for fans.

title: 'He is not knocking on the door': Ashwin's bold message to CSK on Sarfaraz ahead of IPL 2026
content: Sarfaraz Khan brought up his hundred in just 56 balls in what was a breathtaking knock. Ashwin also highlighted the batter‚Äôs performances in the recently concluded Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT), where he amassed 329 runs in seven matches at a strike rate of 203.08 and an average of 65.80.

title: Tragic: Sikandar Raza's brother passes away at 13; Zimbabwe star posts emotional message
content: Raza himself responded to the tragic news on social media, sharing a broken heart emoji beneath Zimbabwe Cricket‚Äôs condolence message. The personal loss comes at a demanding phase in Raza‚Äôs professional career. He was last seen in action for the Sharjah Warriorz during the ILT20 2025, where he featured in 10 matches, scoring 171 runs and picking up 10 wickets.

title: What next for Neerja Modi School after CBSE withdrawal; long road for reaffiliation
content: CBSE has withdrawn the affiliation of Neerja Modi School, Jaipur following a fatal fall of a Class IV student and findings of serious safety violations. The decision affects students, parents, and staff, with new admissions barred and several classes required to shift schools. While senior students may complete Board exams, the school faces a long and conditional path towards possible reaffiliation after strict compliance with CBSE safety norms.

title: Indian-origin Mamdani sworn in as New York City first Muslim mayor at historic subway station ‚Äî watch
content: Indian-origin Zohran Mamdani was sworn in as New York City's first Muslim mayor early Thursday, beginning a four-year term. The 34-year-old Democrat took the oath at the City Hall subway station, with a larger public ceremony to follow. Mamdani, known for his left-leaning views, previously served in the New York State Assembly.

title: NFL playoff schedule, projected bracket: Here's what to know in both conferences
content: the playoffs will begin Saturday, Jan. 10 with the first two wild-card round games . there are two open spots (one in each conference), uncertainty for both the AFC and NFC 1-seeds and a few division titles out there for the taking . we won't know the complete playoff bracket until late Sunday night .

title: No more Exit 30: Davidson renames historic exit after Stephen Curry
content: Stephen Curry is renamed Stephen Curry Interchange for his contributions to the school's men's basketball program . the star has worn the number 30 throughout his college and the pro career . he wore his Davidson sweatsuit along with a pair of "Carmine" Air Jordan Retro 6's .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Where all 30 teams stack up
content: the New York Knicks are sporting the no. 3 best offense in the league in December . but keep an eye on the race for the play-in as we approach the back half of the regular season . it's a close race at the top of the East with the Detroit Pistons holding strong at No. 1 .

title: 'Need this on my fridge': Bucs TEs' festive Christmas cards lost in mail
content: two Tampa Bay Buccaneers teammates posted a series of hilariously awkward holiday photos on Instagram . the two were seen wearing matching head-to-toe outfits and striking an assortment of cheesy poses in front of a Christmas tree . no players were injured attempting the stunt .

title: Our 2025 All-Rookie Team: We picked standout first-years at every single position
content: all rookies make bad plays, and peak performances are weighed fairly heavily . this list is based on the bulk of positive plays . it's the right time to summarize some seasonlong performances . we turn our eyes to the race to super Bowl LX .

title: ACC preview: Final Four contenders, more March Madness predictions
content: the 18-team league received its lowest number of NCAA bids in more than a decade . it hasn't been a top-three conference since before 2020 . the ACC had eight top-40 teams in 2019 compared to last season's four .

title: I&B ministry denies directing edits to Dhurandhar, says changes proposed by makers
content: ministry of information and broadcasting denied reports claiming it directed edits to the blockbuster film Dhurandhar . ministry said no instructions were issued by the government to mute words or revise dialogues . the ministry said the changes under scrutiny were initiated by filmmakers themselves .
